div.div: School Will Remain Closed For Rest of School Year / Lunch Information

p.strong: A MESSAGE TO PARENTS AND STUDENTS:

div.p: After listening to Governor Noem’s press conference today, it is apparent that we will be dealing with the COVID-19 epidemic for quite some time; therefore, we are planning for the long-term. With mitigation efforts in place throughout South Dakota, it appears that the “peak” infection dates will be sometime mid to late June and that these mitigation efforts will be necessary to keep in place until sometime in August. Please keep in mind that these projections are fluid and subject to change.

I would like to take this opportunity to reach out to let you know that we will make every effort to continue to provide meaningful and purposeful instruction to all Sioux Valley students. I have encouraged teachers and other staff members to continue to keep open lines of communication with students and parents.

Effective Monday, April 6, 2020, Sioux Valley School District will be offering free lunch and breakfast meals to ALL children ages zero to 18. The requirements that children must be present has been waived. The restriction that children are enrolled at Sioux Valley School has been waived. Volga Christian students are also eligible for free meals.

I will continue to share information and decisions with you that are made at the administrative and school board levels and beyond. Governor Noem will be providing schools with more direction and guidance sometime next week.

I encourage all students, parents, and families to continue to practice social distancing and personal hygiene guidelines in order to “level the curve” regarding the spread of the virus. It is imperative that we all work together to get through this crisis. Let’s all do what we can to try and stay physically and mentally healthy.

p.strong: Sioux Valley School District will be offering

free lunch and breakfast meals to ALL children ages zero to 18. The requirements that children be present has been waived. The restriction that children are enrolled at Sioux Valley School has been waived.

div.p: These meals will be grab and go meals that will be picked up and taken off site to eat. On Fridays, meals may be picked up for the upcoming weekend as well. There will be two meal pick up locations for our students:
Bruce – the Sioux Valley School bus will be parked on Main Street from 10:00 am to 11:00 am. Students can stop and pick up their grab and go breakfast meal and lunch meal.

Volga – Enter the school through the Commons entrance. Food service staff will be set up in the vestibule so there isn’t a need to enter the school. Breakfast and lunch meals will be available for pick up from 10:00 am to 12:30 pm.
Sinai – Call the kitchen staff at 627-5657 ext 276 if you are interested in breakfast and lunch.
If it is a hardship to get to one of these sites, please contact the kitchen at 605-627-5657, extension 276.
Have a great weekend!
LAURA K. SCHUSTER, SUPERINTENDENT
SIOUX VALLEY SCHOOLS

div.p:
Governor Noem has declared a STATE OF EMERGENCY in South Dakota in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Governor Noem’s STATE OF EMERGENCY order recommends the closing of ALL SCHOOLS statewide next week.
Therefore, Sioux Valley Schools will be closed ALL of next week, March 16-20. BASE will be closed ALL of next week, as well.
Students will NOT be allowed in the school buildings next week. We strongly encourage students, staff, and family members to limit travel and social gatherings this weekend and next week.

Thank you.
Laura K. Schuster, Supt.
Sioux Valley Schools
